text:
[Cites 
9
, Cited by 
0
]

Calcutta High Court (Appellete Side)

498A/506 Of The Indian Penal Code vs In Re : Sekh Mosgul @ Sk. Nosgul on 17 December, 2024

 17.12.2024
 36
 sdas
 Allowed

 C.R.M. (A) No. 4419 of 2024

 In Re:- An application for anticipatory bail under Section
 482 of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita in connection
 with Panrui Police Station Case No. 119 of 2024 dated
 30.07.2024 under 
Sections 420
/
467
/
468
/
471
/
474
/
120B
/
 
498A
/
506
 of the Indian Penal Code.
 And
 In Re : Sekh Mosgul @ Sk. Nosgul ..... petitioner

 Mr. Sabir Ahmed
 Mr. Golam Karim Chowdhury
 Mr. Tasnim Ahmed
 Mr. Dhiman Banerjee
 Mr. Quazi Ezaz Ahmed
 .....for the petitioner

 Mr. Debasish Roy, learned PP
 Mr. Arijit Ganguly
 Mr. Koushik Kundu
 ....for the State

 1.
 Heard the learned Counsels for the parties.

 2. We have considered the materials on record.

 Present case arose out of a matrimonial discord. Allegation of

 torture is general and omnibus. Allegation of forgery relates to

 transfer of the de facto complainant's property in favour of the

 petitioner by an alleged forged deed. Forged deed is in the

 control and custody of the investigating agency. Custodial

 interrogation for progress of investigation is not necessary but

 petitioner requires to co-operate with investigation in

 accordance with law. Accordingly, we are inclined to grant

 anticipatory bail to the petitioner but subject to condition.

Signed By :

SHANTANU DAS
High Court of
Calcutta
18 th of
December 2024
03:08:26 PM

 2

 3. Accordingly, we direct that in the event of arrest the

 petitioner shall be released on bail upon furnishing a bond of

 Rs.10,000/-, with two sureties of like amount each, to the

 satisfaction of the arresting officer and also be subject to the

 conditions as laid down under 
Section 482(2)
 of the Bharatiya

 Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita and on condition that he shall

 appear before the jurisdictional court and pray for regular bail

 within a period of four weeks from date and on further

 condition that he shall meet the investigating officer once in a

 week until further orders and shall provide his specimen

 signature and hand-writing, if necessary.

 4. The application for anticipatory bail is, thus, allowed.

 (Gaurang Kanth, J.) (Joymalya Bagchi, J.)

Signed By :

SHANTANU DAS
High Court of
Calcutta
18 th of
December 2024
03:08:26 PM

Mr. Debasish Roy, learned PP
 Mr. Arijit Ganguly

 ....for the State

1.
 Heard the learned Counsels for the parties.
2. We have considered the materials on record.
Present case arose out of a matrimonial discord. Allegation of
torture is general and omnibus. Allegation of forgery relates to
transfer of the de facto complainant's property in favour of the
petitioner by an alleged forged deed. Forged deed is in the
control and custody of the investigating agency. Custodial
interrogation for progress of investigation is not necessary but
petitioner requires to co-operate with investigation in
accordance with law. Accordingly, we are inclined to grant
anticipatory bail to the petitioner but subject to condition.
Signed By :

SHANTANU DAS
High Court of
Calcutta
18 th of
December 2024
03:08:26 PM
3. Accordingly, we direct that in the event of arrest the
petitioner shall be released on bail upon furnishing a bond of
Rs.10,000/-, with two sureties of like amount each, to the
satisfaction of the arresting officer and also be subject to the

conditions as laid down under 
Section 482(2)
 of the Bharatiya
Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita and on condition that he shall
appear before the jurisdictional court and pray for regular bail
within a period of four weeks from date and on further
condition that he shall meet the investigating officer once in a
week until further orders and shall provide his specimen
signature and hand-writing, if necessary.
4. The application for anticipatory bail is, thus, allowed.
(Gaurang Kanth, J.) (Joymalya Bagchi, J.)
Signed By :

SHANTANU DAS
High Court of
Calcutta
18 th of
December 2024
03:08:26 PM

citations.raw: Of The Indian Penal Code vs In Re

suggested_precedents.full_citation: Arnesh Kumar v. State of Bihar, (2014) 8 SCC 273
suggested_precedents.legal_principle: Mandatory arrest not required for offences punishable less than 7 years
